Experience Senior Developer IBM December 2012  – Present (2 years 9 months) At IBM, I work on a team of 12 people developing a web application used for logistics support. The application has a Javascript front-end using multiple libraries including JQuery, MooTools, and Knockout. Our back-end consists of an ReST services layer implemented using EJBs (JavaEE 6), with data stored in a variety of supported databases including Oracle, PostreSQL, and Derby. My main tasks on a day-to-day basis for this application are API design, architectural analysis, and development. 
 
In addition to this application, I work on the Architectural Design and Review Board. This group is responsible for analyzing customer requirements and deciding upon the best solution given the state of our current systems. We will decide if the requirements are already met by an existing application, if a COTS product would be more cost-efficient, or, if development is required, which technologies should be used and which skill sets are needed. This is finished by an estimate of the rough order of magnitude for the task. 
 
I also work to maintain and develop enterprise libraries used throughout our organization, and I have recently started mentoring new hires for Java Developer positions. Computer Programmer Jacobs Technology January 2009  –  December 2012  (4 years) Huntsville, Alabama Area I write Java software for Jacobs Technology using Test-Driven Development. I design and write JSF/Spring web applications as well as enterprise-level utilities and libraries, and web services. Recently I have been creating authentication proxies for web services using the Oracle Service Bus.  
 
I am a member of the company's Java Enterprise Group, which is a kind of standards and technology group which helps enforce quality and guides the current processes and standards for Java programmers as well as our organization in general. In addition, we provide training for the other developers in our organization for general programming, programming techniques, and tools which make us more efficient at our jobs. As a member of this group I help others adhere to best practices and provide code reviews and advice. 
 
Research and develop new technologies to improve our processes and abilities as an organization. We use a large suite of tools including Maven, Ant, JIRA, Jenkins, Confluence, Code Collaborator, SoapUI, IntelliJ IDEA, Eclipse, Oracle (BEA) Weblogic, Oracle Database, Oracle Service Bus, and TOAD for Oracle. 
 
Designed and implemented enterprise library for displaying and exporting data configurations in multiple formats using a combination of custom JSF components and an extendible report architecture.
